result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorene A Villers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with the stores listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Maintain employment and/or school combination. Inform agent of all prescriptions, sign releases. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Must report by 8pm on 12/03/15.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dorene A Villers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1.State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 0 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR  ***CONCURRENT TO CURRENT PROBATION***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: store listes in Criminal Complaint
____Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COSTS:  $253 + $200 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bond posted remainder as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 10 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Defendant must report BY December 3, 2015 by 8:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-19-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Dorene A Villers in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attonrey Kershek requests an adjournment so Defendant can complete a class.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 10-01-2015 02:30 pm
requesting an adjournment for the court date of August 31, 2015 filed by Attorney Kershek.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant can have contact with her mother but not to discuss the case with her mother.  Defendant to have no contact with witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.
